title: Inter Milan issue injury update on Man United loanee Alexis Sanchez
text:
Alexis Sanchez is set for a prolonged period on the sidelines (Picture: Getty)

Alexis Sanchez looks set for a prolonged period on the sidelines after suffering a dislocated ankle and accompanying tendon damage while playing for Chile against Colombia on Saturday.

The 30-year-old, who joined Inter Milan on a season-long loan from Manchester United in August, is waiting to discover whether or not he requires surgery for the problem.

Sanchez has made a decent start to his Inter career, scoring a goal and providing an assist in four appearances overall, although he was also sent off in a 3-1 win over Sampdoria.

Sanchez was substituted late on during Chile’s 0-0 draw against Colombia on Saturday (Picture: Getty)

An Inter statement read: ‘Alexis Sanchez underwent medical tests earlier this morning at the Humanitas Institute in Rozzano. Results revealed a joint dislocation in his left ankle which has caused damage to the peroneus longus tendon.

‘The player will meet for further consultations with Professor Ramon Cugat in Barcelona on Wednesday, where they will seek to reach a decision on whether surgical intervention is necessary.’

Sanchez has been plagued by injury problems over the past year, missing a number of games for United due to separate hamstring, thigh, knee and ankle issues prior to his move away.

The winger’s international manager Reinaldo Rueda, meanwhile, suggested that he could be unavailable for the next three months depending on what course of action Inter decide to take.

‘If he has surgery you will lose him for two to three months, if not, it can be weeks, that depends on the club,’ Rueda said.

‘You always want to have them all here and losing Alexis is a shame, he was cheerful and super motivated.’

Sanchez’s only goal for Inter so far came during a 3-1 win over struggling Sampdoria in September (Picture: Getty)

Regardless of how well Sanchez performs during his time in Italy, it appears unlikely that he has any sort of future at Old Trafford following a disastrous 18-month spell at the club.

According to reports last week, United are hoping to recoup a £25m fee for Sanchez which seems ambitious unless he can rediscover his best form during his stint at Inter.
